page.title: 08EVENTS IN CASTLE STREET
page.content: These include the Pageants of the early 1900's which took place at the castle from time to time. After the Second World War these were replaced by the Galas which were held every year and these were finally replaced by the annual fetes which are held in mid June during the Flower Festival. Other well-remembered occurances were the floods between 1912 and 1918 which left Castle Street under several feet of water. 1935, and Portchester celebrated King George V's Silver Jubilee by planting an oak tree in Castle Street. In 1980 Castle Street was used as a set for a television programme set in the past called "Brenden Chase". In 1983 a Son et Lumiere was held at the castle which told the history of the monument.
